post.body: hotwatr.com is available. actually not a bad domain. not so sure about heatrlea.kn
they stopped Times Select last year. I think content should be free, but they'd make more money if they let me pay to hide ads.
awww... i suppose claire has priority. after all, she's Sheep's person.
... or Sheep can come visit me! *dangles new camera*
oooh *sprinkles yogurt chips*
ooh, it's all swirly
huh. air raid sirens going off. i'm going to assume it's actually not an air raid.
over 30 seconds to bring Firefox to the foreground and open a new window. why? why?!!! hell, my old mac did better 10 years ago.
crap, almost 4am. time for bed.
has a really crazy idea.
i wish there was a way to give money to @nytimes that didn't involve having a pile of dead trees delivered to my door step every day...
sometimes it frustrates me that we get faster and faster computers but slower and slower software so the same tasks never get faster.
oof. had over 9 hours of meetings today... i'm glad i work with smart people though.
oof... can't sleep (2:30am in Tokyo)
finally stopped using my own mail server (all my aliases now forward to gmail). my IMAP account has email going back to 2000...
if Bush really believes in freedom, he should ask for the shoe thrower's release. we're supposed to be liberators, aren't we?
might be approaching margin of error... feeling marginally erroneous? erroneously marginal?
oof... so hungry I'm dizzy. weird.
wondered why my GMail "Tree" theme is raining... then realized it thinks I'm in Mountain View. so... apparently it's rain today over there.
trying to decide which microcontroller board to use... Make, Arduino, BASIC Stamp, something else?
anyone know where i can get a list of english dictionary words and their expected rate of occurrence in a relatively modern corpus?
trying to decide what to do for New Years. options: stay home, go to the desert, go to another city (DC, Chicago, Portland, or other)
On the California Zephyr. 53 hours to Emeryville. The sleeper is cozy!
Mmmm chocolate croissant from teh Med bakery
Reading "OLIVIA helps with Christmas" at Borders on 53rd st.
Took an early morning walk along Lake Michigan. Such a magical place.
kinda want to go for a walk, but slightly intimidated by the 20F weather... *sigh* i've grown soft.
at moomers. i haz a restless purry kitteh on my belly.
Landed at midway. 43 degrees? WTF? I coulda stayed home if I wanted sunny and 40s.
Blue van showed up 11 min late. Would've been too late for plan B (caltrain)
The 15 minute "window" just closed. Those fucktards. Hm... Walk to the caltrain or drive?
I have this bad feeling that super shuttle isn't going to show up.
ack, it's past 7pm. time for bed, so i can get up at 4am.
moved tomorrow's Chicago flight up 8 hours. which means 8 fewer hours to unpack, repack... and I haven't slept properly in over 40 hours.
i actually enjoy talking to Southwest's customer service agents on the phone... they're like the midwestern grandma i never had.
ahhhh home sweet home.
Landed at SFO. Nearly exactly 24 hrs since leaving BKK, with a 9 hr layover in Tokyo. Tomorrow: Chicago
eating mangoes and doing some writing out on the patio, with Bangkok to my back.
filled up 4GB SD card with photos and videos... didn't think I'd actually use up all that space.
took a train to Ayuthaya - the kind of train with wooden seats and an open window that lets in the sights, smells and dust of the country
